column1: On [[18 October]] [[1954]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"
column2: a letter]] to the Rector of the [[Wikipedia:University of Liège

column1: *'''Subject:'''The letter concerns the festivities of Tolkien's reception of an honorary doctorate at the University of Liège on [[2 October
column2: October 2]]nd, [[1954]] (he was suggested as a candidate by [[Simonne d'Ardenne]]).

column1: *'''Publication:''' The letter was reprinted in full in the article "Tolkien and Belgium" by [[Johan Vanhecke]], published in ''[[Lembas Extra: Proceedings of the 5th Unquendor Lustrum]]''.
*'''Archive''': The letter is kept at the University Archives in Liège.

column2: I returned from Belgium to considerate pressure of business, and have been obliged to come to Ireland on academic affairs.
column3: J.R.R. Tolkien (in ''[[Lembas Extra: Proceedings of the 5th Unquendor Lustrum]]'', p.57)}}
